did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Winchester (Va.) Marriage Records and Vital Statistics, 1790-1976 bulk (1932-1976)
did.physloc: State Records Center--Archives Annex, Library of Virginia

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Winchester (Va.) Marriage Records and Vital Statistics, 1790-1976 bulk (1932-1976). Local government records collection, Winchester (City) Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These boxes and volumes came to the Library of Virginia in a shipment of court records from Winchester (City.)

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The City of Winchester, in Frederick County, was first known as Opequon, then as Frederick's Town (or Fredericktown), and, finally, upon establishment as a town in 1752, as Winchester. According to tradition, one of the town's founders, James Wood, named the town in honor of his birthplace in England. Winchester was incorporated as a town in 1779 and as a city in 1874. It was enlarged by annexation from Frederick County in 1970.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Winchester (Va.) Marriage Records and Vital Statistics, 1790-1976 bulk (1932-1976) consist of boxes of Marriage Records, Marriage Registers Nos. 1-35, an Index to Marriage Register No. 1, a Register of Deaths and an undated Index to a Register of Births.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged by date or alphabetically by surnames for indexes.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Winchester (City) Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm.
